page.title: 02HEDGEROWS,VERGES BOREHAM
page.content: Many of the fields and roads are bounded by hedges.In the North of the area, and particularly on the edge of Fords Proving Ground,the hedges are quite high. A typical hedge was examined and the following species were noted. Common Ash, Oak and Beech,Hazel, Hawthorn, Blackthorn. Elder, Dog Rose.and Blackberry. The verges are generally narrow no more than a meter in some cases. There are a few wider ones in the Russell Green area, and one of these included the following plant cover A variety of grasses including Annual Meadow Grass, and Common Rye Grass, Rosebay Willow Herb,Daisy, Clover, Cow Parsley, Buttercup,Shepherds,Purse, Birdsfoot-trefoil, and Bindweed.The The Field Poppy may be seen in sandy areas,especially near the golf course.
